titleStmt.title: A third proceeding in the harmonie of King Dauids harp that is to say, a godly and learned exposition vpon 17. Psalmes moe of the princely prophet Dauid, beginning with the 45. and ending with the 61. Psalme: done in Latine by the learned Reuerend Doctor Victorinus Strigelius, Professor of Diuinitie in the Vniuersitie of Lypsia in Germanie, anno Christi, 1562. Translated into English, by Richard Robinson citizen of London. An. Christi, 1595. Seene, perused, and allowed.
Hypomnēmata in omnes Psalmos Davidis. Psalm 45-61. English
titleStmt.author: Strigel, Victorinus, 1524-1569.
Robinson, Richard, citizen of London.

notesStmt.note: A translation of Psalms 45-61 of: Hypomnēmata in omnes Psalmos Davidis.
Printed "at the charges of Richard Banckworth", according to Robinson's manuscript "Eupolemia"; see "The Library", XI (1930), p. 177.
The first leaf and the last leaf are blank.
Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
